attributes.PROJECT_FULL_TITLE: Internal hydrogen infrastructure in Germany connecting to France [currently known as H2Hercules South]
attributes.TECHNICAL_DESCR:
The H2ercules South project will enable pure hydrogen imports from various regions of hydrogen production: Iberian Peninsula via France to Medelsheim, Germany as well as Baltic Sea, Eastern Europe and North Africa via Czechia to Waidhaus, Germany.

This project connects the demand centers in Bavaria, such as Ingolstadt or Nuremberg, which are characterised by a lot of industry (steel industry, refineries, chemical parks and others) and thus offer numerous decarbonization opportunities for the use of hydrogen.

The infrastructure concerns sections: I – MEGAL of approx. 458 km of repurposed pipelines and II – connection Ingolstadt of approx. 103 km of repurposed pipelines.

The aimed transmission capacity from France to Germany and reverse is estimated at 192 GWh/day (1.8 Mt/y).
